description: If there was ever an opportunity to freely share software, it is among local governments. Software built for cities and counties is paid for with our tax dollars, and each of the 10,000 cities and counties in the US face more or less the same challenges, but face them individually, building or buying the same solutions one at a time. Efforts in the US and Canada are starting to address this issue, and at the same time enable a vision for the Open City. Come learn explore the opportunity to contribute to an ecosystem around open source civic software and the chance to code the next chapter of American history.
title: Build it Locally, Spread it Nationally: the Opportunity for Open Source in Municipal Government
